template.description: Ingest logs from folders and UDP port, stream real-time log events to dashboard, persist logs to Solr for historical search
template.name: collect-stream-logs

value.description: the port to listen on for incoming connections
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: URL context path where clients can connect
value.name: URL prefix

value.description: permitted matches for inbound (client->server) traffic
value.name: inbound address regex

value.description: permitted matches for outbound (server->client) traffic
value.name: outbound address regex

value.description: address where outbound message will be published
value.name: outbound address

value.description: The ControllerService that is used to obtain eventBus instance
value.name: Vertx Service

processGroups.comments: Ingest logs from folders and UDP port, stream real-time log events to dashboard, persist logs to Solr for historical search.

value.description: The number of lines that will be added to each split file
value.name: Line Split Count

value.description: The number of lines that should be considered part of the header; the header lines will be duplicated to all split files
value.name: Header Line Count

value.description: Whether to remove newlines at the end of each split file. This should be false if you intend to merge the split files later
value.name: Remove Trailing Newlines

processors.name: split log file and feed line by line

relationships.description: If a file cannot be split for some reason, the original file will be routed to this destination and nothing will be routed elsewhere
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The original input file will be routed to this destination when it has been successfully split into 1 or more files
relationships.name: original

relationships.description: The split files will be routed to this destination when an input file is successfully split into 1 or more split files
relationships.name: splits

value.description: The input directory from which to pull files
value.name: Input Directory

value.description: Only files whose names match the given regular expression will be picked up
value.name: File Filter

value.description: When Recurse Subdirectories is true, then only subdirectories whose path matches the given regular expression will be scanned
value.name: Path Filter

value.description: The maximum number of files to pull in each iteration
value.name: Batch Size

value.description: If true, the file is not deleted after it has been copied to the Content Repository; this causes the file to be picked up continually and is useful for testing purposes. If not keeping original NiFi will need write permissions on the directory it is pulling from otherwise it will ignore the file.
value.name: Keep Source File

value.description: Indicates whether or not to pull files from subdirectories
value.name: Recurse Subdirectories

value.description: Indicates how long to wait before performing a directory listing
value.name: Polling Interval

value.description: Indicates whether or not hidden files should be ignored
value.name: Ignore Hidden Files

value.description: The minimum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Minimum File Age

value.description: The maximum age that a file must be in order to be pulled; any file older than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored
value.name: Maximum File Age

value.description: The minimum size that a file must be in order to be pulled
value.name: Minimum File Size

value.description: The maximum size that a file can be in order to be pulled
value.name: Maximum File Size

relationships.description: All files are routed to success
relationships.name: success

value.description: address where outbound message will be published
value.name: outbound address

value.description: The ControllerService that is used to obtain eventBus instance
value.name: Vertx Service

relationships.description: any flowFile that cannot be published to EventBus will be routed to failure
relationships.name: failure

value.description: IP, or name, of a remote host. Only Datagrams from the specified Sending Host Port and this host will be accepted. Improves Performance. May be a system property or an environment variable.
value.name: Sending Host

value.description: Port being used by remote host to send Datagrams. Only Datagrams from the specified Sending Host and this port will be accepted. Improves Performance. May be a system property or an environment variable.
value.name: Sending Host Port

value.description: The name of a local network interface to be used to restrict listening for UDP Datagrams to a specific LAN.May be a system property or an environment variable.
value.name: Local Network Interface

value.description: Scheduling interval for each read channel.
value.name: Channel Reader Interval

value.description: Determines the (almost) upper bound size at which a flow file would be generated.
value.name: FlowFile Size Trigger

value.description: Determines the size each receive buffer may be
value.name: Max Buffer Size

value.description: The maximum UDP buffer size that should be used. This is a suggestion to the Operating System to indicate how big the udp socket buffer should be.
value.name: Max size of UDP Buffer

value.description: Port to listen on. Must be known by senders of Datagrams.
value.name: Port

value.description: Number of receiving buffers to be used to accept data from the socket. Higher numbers means more ram is allocated but can allow better throughput.
value.name: Receive Buffer Count

value.description: The number of flow files per session.
value.name: FlowFiles Per Session

value.description: The time out period when waiting to receive data from the socket. Specify units.
value.name: Receive Timeout

value.description: Determines if this processor emits each datagram as a FlowFile, or if multiple datagrams can be placed in a single FlowFile.
value.name: FlowFile Per Datagram

relationships.description: Connection which contains concatenated Datagram Packets
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Regular Expression to search for in the FlowFile content
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to replace the regular expression with. Back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value.
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the regular expressions. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored and the buffer is not used if 'Regular Expression' is set to '.*'
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Evaluate the 'Regular Expression' against each line (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and then evaluate the 'Regular Expression'.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully updated are routed to this relationship, as well as FlowFiles whose content does not match the given Regular Expression
relationships.name: success

value.description: Indicates whether the results of the JsonPath evaluation are written to the FlowFile content or a FlowFile attribute; if using attribute, must specify the Attribute Name property. If set to flowfile-content, only one JsonPath may be specified, and the property name is ignored.
value.name: Destination

value.description: Indicates the desired return type of the JSON Path expressions. Selecting 'auto-detect' will set the return type to 'json' for a Destination of 'flowfile-content', and 'scalar' for a Destination of 'flowfile-attribute'.
value.name: Return Type

value.description: Indicates how to handle missing JSON path expressions when destination is set to 'flowfile-attribute'. Selecting 'warn' will generate a warning when a JSON path expression is not found.
value.name: Path Not Found Behavior

value.description: Indicates the desired representation of JSON Path expressions resulting in a null value.
value.name: Null Value Representation

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath cannot be evaluated against the content of the FlowFile; for instance, if the FlowFile is not valid JSON
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the JsonPath does not match the content of the FlowFile and the Destination is set to flowfile-content
relationships.name: unmatched

processGroups.name: Collect Stream Logs
